parallel

Class DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor3

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor3

  • public final class DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor3
extends java.lang.Object
    Exactly the same as DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor2 class, only that the thread-pool's threads' hot local queue is also unbounded (as is the cold local queue), as is the global shared queue, so that all associated queues are unbounded, and therefore do not act as "synchronizers" between the executor threads (see Brian Goetz et al "Java Concurrency in Practice").

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2015

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      nested helper class indicates shut-down of thread-pool.
      (package private) class  DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor3.DATEThread3
      nested helper class for DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor3.
      (package private) class  DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor3.IdleThreadWorkRequest
      nested helper class indicates some thread found no work to do and went blocking waiting for some data on the global pool.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor3

        private DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor3(int numthreads,
                                   int maxthreads)
                            throws ParallelException
        private constructor, constructing a thread-pool of numthreads threads.
        Parameters:
        numthreads - int the number of initial threads in the thread-pool
        maxthreads - int the max. number of threads in the thread-pool
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if numthreads ≤ 0 or if maxthreads < numthreads.

      • DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor3

        private DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor3(int numthreads,
                                   int maxthreads,
                                   boolean runoncurrent)
                            throws ParallelException
        private constructor, constructing a thread-pool of numthreads threads.
        Parameters:
        numthreads - int the number of threads in the thread-pool.
        maxthreads - int the max number of threads in the thread-pool.
        runoncurrent - boolean if false no task will run on current thread in case the threads in the pool are full and no new thread can be created.
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if numthreads ≤ 0 or if numthreads > maxthreads.

      • getNumTasksInQueue

        public int getNumTasksInQueue()
        get the current number of tasks in the queue awaiting processing.
        Returns:
        int

      • execute

        public void execute(java.lang.Runnable task)
             throws ParallelException
        the main method of the class. Submits a Runnable interface for execution, and the thread-pool will ignore any exceptions any task may throw when its run() method is invoked. The call is asynchronous, so that the method does return immediately without waiting for any task to complete; however, if all threads in the thread-pool are busy and there is no room for a new thread and the DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor3 was constructed via the two-argument constructor, or the third argument in the three-argument constructor was true, then the task executes in the current thread.
        Parameters:
        task - Runnable
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if the shutDown() method has been called prior to this call

      • submitToSameThread

        public void submitToSameThread(ThreadSpecificTaskObject tsto)
                        throws ParallelException,
                               java.lang.ClassCastException
        forces the argument to be pushed to the current thread's "hot" local queue of tasks, a fast unsynchronized operation.
        Parameters:
        tsto -
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if argument does not designate it should run from the current thread's id.
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if current thread is not a DATEThread3 object.

      • resubmitToSameThread

        public void resubmitToSameThread(java.lang.Runnable tsto)
                          throws java.lang.ClassCastException
        forces the argument to be pushed to the current thread's cold local queue of tasks, a fast unsynchronized operation.
        Parameters:
        tsto - Runnable
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if current thread is not a DATEThread3 object.

      • hotLocalQueueCurrentlyHasCapacity

        public boolean hotLocalQueueCurrentlyHasCapacity()
                                          throws java.lang.ClassCastException

        Returns:
        boolean
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if current thread is not a DATEThread3 object.

      • getCurrentThreadId

        public int getCurrentThreadId()
                       throws java.lang.ClassCastException

        Returns:

      • shutDown

        public void shutDown()
              throws ParallelException
        shut-down all the threads in this executor's thread-pool. It is the caller's responsibility to ensure that after this method has been called no other thread (including the threads in the thread-pool) will call the execute() method. Use of condition-counters or similar may be necessary when tasks given to the thread-pool for execution may call the execute() method recursively. The executor cannot be used afterwards, and will throw ParallelException if the method execute() or shutDown() is called again.
        Throws:
        ParallelException

      • shutDownAndWait4Threads

        public void shutDownAndWait4Threads()
                             throws ParallelException,
                                    java.lang.InterruptedException
        calls shutDown() and waits for each thread in the pool to finish execution. Obviously, must be called only once.
        Throws:
        ParallelException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • getNumThreads

        public int getNumThreads()
        return the number of threads in the thread-pool.
        Returns:
        int

      • incrNumTasksHandled

        private void incrNumTasksHandled()
        invoked only by the threads in the thread-pool to indicate finishing (normal or abnormal) of a task execution.

      • getObjId

        private int getObjId()

      • isOK2SubmitTask

        private boolean isOK2SubmitTask()
        compute the difference between total tasks submitted to the associated UnboundedSimpleFasterMsgPassingCoordinator object, and the total tasks run by the threads in the thread-pool, and return ok if this number is less than the total current number of threads. Only called from within the synchronized block of the execute(task) method.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • isOK2RunOnCurrentThread

        private boolean isOK2RunOnCurrentThread(java.lang.Runnable task)

        private static int getNextObjId()
